title: The Registration of Titles Cadastral Mapping and Tenure Clarificatio
title_en: The Registration of Titles Cadastral Mapping and Tenure Clarificatio
short_name: Registration of Titles Cadastral Mapping and Tenure Clarificatio

provisions.title: Section 1
provisions.content:
1. These Regulations may be cited as the Registration of Titles, Cadastral Citation.
         Mapping and Tenure Clarification (Special Provisions) (Adjudication
         Committees) Regulations, 2007.

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. The area set out in Part 1 of the Schedule, which is delineated on the Schdu'"
map set out in Part I1 thereof, is hereby declared to be a project area for the
purposes of section 3 of the Act and shall be known as the St. Catherine
Project Area 1 .
    THE REGISTRA T1ON.OFTITLES CADASTRA L MAPPING (SPECIAL PROVISIONS)
                 (ST. CATHERINE PROJECTAREA I ) ORDER, 2006
                             Part I. Area ofthe St Catherine
     Commencing at the junction of the %.-Catherine, and St. Andrew parish boundary and the
northern boundary of the Mandela Highway at Fresh River; thence generally in a north-westerly
and northerly direction.along the, said parish boundary to it's junction with the St. MaryISt.
Catherine and the St. MarylSt. Andrew parish boundaries at Border; thence generally north-
                                                                                                          -
westerly and south-westerly alongthe St. MarylSt. Catherine parish boundary to its junction with
the St. MaryISt. Ann parish boundary atGuys Hill; thence continuing in a generally south-
westerly direction along the St. AnnISt. Catherine parish boundary to its junction, with the St.'
AnnIClarendon and St. C.atherine/Clarendon parish boundaries at Pedro River; thence. generally
south-easterly and southerly along the St. CatherindClarendon parish boundary to its intersection
with the western boundary,of the parochial road leading from Bellas Gate to Sandy Bay; thence
generally south-westerly and southerly along the western boundary of the said parochial road to
its intersection with the eastern boundary of the Sandy Bay to Old Harbour main road; thence
southerly to the western boundary of the said main road; thence generally in a. southeasterly         .
direction along the western boundary of the said road to its junction with the St.
CatherineIClarendon parish boundary; thence generally southerly along the parish boundary,to
its junction with the coastline; thence generally in a northeasterly and southeasterly direction
along the coastline to the centre line of Salt Island Creek; thence generally northeaiterly dong
the centre line of Salt Island Creek to its intersection with the eastern boundary of the parochial
 road at Hill Run; thence generally northeasterly along the eastern boundary of the Parochial
 Road to its intersection with the northern boundary of the Jamaica Railway Corporation line
 leading -Ifom Gregory Park to Bog Walk; thence continuing northeasterly along the eastern
 boundary of Lower Oxford Road to its junction with the southern boundary of Burke Road;
 thence northerly to the junction of the northern boundary of Burke Road and the eastern
 boundary of Oxford Road thence southeasterly and northeasterly-aIong the northern boundary
 of BurkeRoad to its junction with the western boundary of Barren Street thence northeasterly to
 the junction of the eastern boundary of Barrett Street with the northern boundary of the main
 road continuing from Burke Road to Kingston; thence northeasterly and easterly along the
 northern boundary of the main road to the junction of the northern boundary of the round-a-bout
 at Jose Marti and the northern boundary of the Mandela Highway; thence continuing easterly,
 northeasterly along the northern boundary of the Mandela Highway and back to the starting
 point.

       new caveat (up to the amount secured by the
       caveat being withdrawn) shall be S50.00 and for
       each additional one thousand dollars $5.00.

provisions.title: Section 4
provisions.content:
4.+1) The appointment of every member of the Committee shall be Tenureof
         evidenced by an instnunent in writing; and such instrument shall state the office.
         period of office of the member which shall not exceed three years.
                (2) Every member of the Committee shall be eligible for reappoint-
         ment so, however, that no member shall, at any time, be appointed for more
                                                                                     -
                         me inclusion of thia p q e u authorized by LN. 141~R0101
                       THE REGISTRATION O F TITLES, CADASTRAL MAPPING AND TENURE
                      CLARIFICATION (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) (ADJUDICATION COMMITTEES)
                                            REGULATIONS, 2007
                 than two consecutive terms.
                        (3) The Minister may, at any time, revoke the appointment of the
                 chairman or any other member of the Committee if he thinks it expedient so
                 to do.
                        (4) If a member is absent from three consecutive meetings of the
                 Committee, the Minister may deem the position vacant and appoint a
                 replacement.
                          (5) If any vacancy occurs in the membership of the Committee, the
                 vacancy shall be filled by the appointment of another member who shall,
                 subject to the provisions of fiese Regulations, hold office for the remainder
                 of the period for which the previous member was appointed.
Leave of           5.-The Minister may, on the application of any member, grant to such
absence.         member leave of absence for any period not exceeding six months.
Temporary            6. The Minister may appoint a suitable person to act temporarily in
wpoinmenw.       the place of any member of the Committee in the case of the absence or
                 inability to act of that memher.
Resignations.        7 . 4 1 ) Any member ofithe Committee, other than the chairman, may, at
                 any,time, resign his office by instrument in writing addressed to the Minister
                 and transmitted through the chairman and upon the date of the receipt by
                 the chairman of that instrument, that member shall cease to be a member
                 of the Committee.
                         (2) The chairman may, at any time, resign his office by instrument
                 in writing addressed to the Minister, and such resignation shall have
                 effect as from the date of receipt by the Minister of such
                 instrument.
Publication of      8. The names of all members of the Committee as first constituted and
memhhip.         every change in the membership thereof shall be published in the Gazene.
Authentication  9. All documehts made by, and all decisions of the Committee may be
  documents. signified under the hand of the chairman or any member of the Committee
                 authorized to act in that behalf.
Remuneration         10. There shall be paid to the chairman and other members of the
  members.       Committee such remuneration, whether by way of honorarium, salaries or
                 fees or other allowances, as the Minister may determine.
                                  me helmion of this p a t u glrhorizsd by LN. 141~/7.0101
       THE REGISTRATION OF TITLES, CADASTRAL MAPPING AND TENURE
      CL4RIFICATION (SPECIAL PROVISIONS) (ADJUDICATION COMMllTEES)
                           REGULATIONS. 2007
  1 1 . 4 1 ) The Committee shall meet at such times as may be necessary or       Procedure
expedient for the transaction of business and such meetings shall be held         and meet-
at such place and time and on such days as the Committee may                      ings of
                                                                                  committee.
determine.
         (2) The chairman may, at any time, call a special meeting of the
Committee having given seven days' written notice or on the requisition
for that purpose addressed to him by any two members of the Committee.
        (3) The chairman or, in the case of the absence or inability to act of
the chairman, the person appointed in accordance with the provisions of
regulation 3 shall preside at the meetings of the Committee, and when so
presiding the chairman or the person appointed, as the case may be, shall
have an original and casting vote.
        (4) The quorum of the Committee shall be three members.
         (5) Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, the Committee
shall regulate its own proceedings.
        (6) Minutes of each meeting of the Committee shall be kept in
proper form and shall be c o n h e d as soon as practicable thereafter at the
subsequent meeting.
        (7) The validity of any proceedings of the Committee shall not be
affected by any vacancy among the memben thereof or by any defect in the
appointment of a member thereof.

provisions.title: Section 5
provisions.content:
5.--(I) The appointment of an appointed member shall, subject to
                    the provisions of this Schedule, be for a period not exceeding three years.
                            (2) Every appointed member shall be eligible for reappointment so,
                    however, that no appointed member shall hold office for more than two
                    consecutive terms.
                            (3) If a vacancy occurs in the membership of the Board the vacancy
                    shall be filled by the appointment of another person to the Board who
                    shall, subject to the provisions of these Regulations, hold office for
                    the remainder of the. period for which the previous member was
                    appointed.
RNaation of
appointmems.           6. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary, the Minister may, at any
                    time, terminate the appointment of-
                          (a) any appointed member of the Board; or
                          (b) any member who, without reasonable excuse, is absent fiom three
                               consecutive meetings of the Board.
Leave of absence.

provisions.title: Section 7
provisions.content:
7. The Minister may, on the application of any appointed member,
                    grant to such member leave of absence for any period not exceeding six
                    months.
Trmporny
appn'ntmmtr.

provisions.title: Section 8
provisions.content:
8. The Minister may appoint a suitable person to act temporarily in the
                        place of any appointed member of the Board in the case of the absence or
                        inability to act of such member.                            . .
Resignations.

provisions.title: Section 9
provisions.content:
9.-41) Any appointed member of the Board, other than the chairman
                        may, at any time, resign his office by instrument in writing addressed to the
                        Minister and transmitted through the chairman and upon the date of receipt
                        by the chairman of such instrument, such member shall q x s e to be a member
                        of the Board.
                                        (ras kbii of &kprgs h mhriosd by LN. 141P/20lO]
                    -                        -.               . .... ... - -            .... . -- --
  THE REGISTRATION OF TITLES, CADASTRAL MAPPING (LAND ADMINISTRATION                    9
       AND MANAGEMENT PROGRAMME FUND) (BOARD O F MANAGEMEN7)
                           REGULATIONS. 2007
         (2) The chairman may, at any time, resign his office by instrument
in writing addressed to the Minister, and such resignation shall have effect as
from the date of receipt by the Minister of such instrument.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. The names of all members of the Board as first constituted and every FzE'r
change in the membership thereof shall be published in the Gazette.

provisions.title: Section 11
provisions.content:
11.-41) The Board shall meet at least four times in each year and such kTs,,@
other times as may be necessary or expedient for the transaction of business, o f ~ o u d .
and such meetings shall be held at such places and times and on such days
as the Board may determine.
         (2) The chairman may, at any time, call a special meeting of the
Board after giving seven days' written notice of the intention to do so or on
the written request for that purpose addressed to him by any two members of
the Board.
        (3) The chairman or, in the case of the absence or inability to act of
the chairman, the person elected pursuant to paragraph 3(4) shall preside at
the meetings of the Board.
        (4) The quorum of the Board shall be five.
         (5) The decisions of the Board shall be by a simple majority of votes
and, in addition to an original vote, the chairman or other person presiding at
a meeting shall have a casting vote in any case in which the voting is
equal.
         (6) Subject to the provisions of these Regulations, the Board may
regulate its own proceedings.
        (7) Minutes of each meeting of the Board shall be kept in proper
form and shall be confirmed as soon as practicable thereafter at a subsequent
meeting.
       (8) The validity of the proceedings of the Boprd shall not be affected
by any vacancy among the members of the Board or by any defect in the
appointment of a member of the Board.

provisions.title: Section 12
provisions.content:
12. Any member of the Committee who is directly or indirectly interested Disclosure
in any matter which is being dealt with by the Committee--                     of interest.
       (a) shall as soon as possible after the relevant facts have come to his
           knowledge, disclose the nature of his interest at a meeting of the
           Committee; and
      (b) shall not take part in any deliberation or decision of the
          Committee with respect to this matter.
   1 3 . 4 1 ) No action, suit, prosecution or other paoceedings shall be brought Rotection
or instituted personally against any member of @e Committee in respect of of members.
any act done bonaflde in pursuance or executipn br intended execution of the
Committee's functions under this or any other enactment.
        (2) Where any member of the Committee is exempt fiom liability by
reason only of the provisions of this regulation, the Committee shall be liable
to the extent that it would be if the said member were an employee or an
agent of the Committee.

provisions.title: Section 13
provisions.content:
13. There shall be paid from the funds of the Fund to the chairman and
               other members of the Board such remuneration, (whether by way of
               honorarium, salary or fees) or other allowances, as the Minister may
               determine.

of members.

provisions.title: Section 14
provisions.content:
14.-41) No action, suit, prosecution or other proceedings shall be
               brought or instituted personally against any member of the Board in respect
               of any act done bonajide in pursuance or execution or intended execution of
               the Board's functions under the Act.
                       (2) Where any member of the Board is exempt from liability by
               reason only of the provisions of this regulation, the Board shall be liable
               to the extent that it would be if the member were an employee or an agent
               of the Board.
